child.pub-comments: “Finnic (rather than “Baltic-Finnic” or the like) is the name of the group of closely related languages including Finnish, and... the practice of referring to “Finno-Permian”, i.e. all Uralic languages except Hungarian, Mansi, Khanty and Samoyed, as Finnic should be regarded as obsolete” (Salminen 2012).

child.pub-comments: The author notes that the name Zyryan is used “in the narrow sense excluding Permyak” (Salminen 2012).
